body_html:
I see from the slide number 5 that:

Keras is the official high-level API of
TensorFlow

So is this means that:

  • we have multiple "official high-level API" or
  • that tf.slim and tf.layers are low level/middle level API or
  • the tf.slim and tf.layers are high-level but unofficial

How we need to interpret this?
body_text:
I see from the slide number 5 that:

Keras is the official high-level API of
TensorFlow

So is this means that:

we have multiple "official high-level API" or
that tf.slim and tf.layers are low level/middle level API or
the tf.slim and tf.layers are high-level but unofficial

How we need to interpret this?
body:
I see from the slide [number 5](https://web.stanford.edu/class/cs20si/lectures/march9guestlecture.pdf) that:

> Keras is the official high-level API of 
TensorFlow

So is this means that:
- we have multiple "official high-level API" or
- that tf.slim and tf.layers are low level/middle level API or
- the tf.slim and tf.layers are high-level but unofficial

How we need to interpret this?
